definition: to fold the corner of a page/to dog-ear
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: The boy is really careless, whoes books are folded.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩真粗心，他的書都折角了。

sentences.english: Leave the end hanging loose so you can pull it to tighten the strap .
sentences.chinese: 讓帶子的未端突出如一個松的折角。

sentences.english: The second is diagnosing the closing fault of the train coupling cock.
sentences.chinese: 二是監測列車管折角塞門開通關閉狀態。
不要將借來的書的書頁折角。

sentences.english: Flow features of sharp bend in mountain river are investigated in this article.
sentences.chinese: 對山區河流折角急彎段的基本特徵進行了研究。

sentences.english: The mesoscale rainstorm often occurs around the area with zero radial speed or its inflexion.
sentences.chinese: 中尺度暴雨常出現在零徑向速度附近及其折角處。

definition: broken line (continuous figure made up of straight line segments)/polygonal line/dog leg
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
